summary:
Mammoths were giant, extinct animals related to elephants. They lived for around 6 million years and were found across Africa, Europe, Asia, and North America. Mammoths had long, twisted tusks and some species had thick fur for cold climates.

The first mammoths appeared in Africa and later spread to other continents. The woolly mammoth, known for its fur, lived in Siberia and survived until around 4,000 years ago, overlapping with early human civilizations.
title: Mammoth
